t: Proverbs 4
A Father’s Instruction
Hear,*pn O*i sons, the instruction of a father, And*ln give attention that you may gain understanding,
For*ln I give you sound teaching; Do*ln not abandon my instruction.
When*ln I was a son to my father, Tender*ln and the only son in the sight of my mother,
Then*ln he taught me and said to me, “Let*ln your heart hold fast my words; Keep*ln my commandments and live;
Acquire*ln wisdom! Acquire understanding! Do*ln not forget nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
Do*ln not forsake her, and she will guard you; Love*ln her, and she will watch over you.
The*ln beginning of wisdom is:*i Acquire wisdom; And*ln with all your acquiring, get understanding.
Prize*ln her, and she will exalt you; She*ln will honor you if you embrace her.
She*ln will place on your head a garland of grace; She*ln will present you with a crown of beauty.”
Hear,*ln my son, and accept my sayings And*ln the years of your life will be many.
I*ln have directed you in the way of wisdom; I*ln have led you in upright paths.
When*ln you walk, your steps will not be impeded; And*ln if you run, you will not stumble.
Take*ln hold of instruction; do not let go. Guard*ln her, for she is your life.
Do*ln not enter the path of the wicked And*ln do not proceed in the way of evil men.
Avoid*ln it, do not pass by it; Turn*ln away from it and pass on.
For*ln they cannot sleep unless they do evil; And*ln they are robbed of sleep unless they make someone*i stumble.
For*ln they eat the bread of wickedness And*ln drink the wine of violence.
But*ln the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn, That*ln shines brighter and brighter until the full day.
The*ln way of the wicked is like darkness; They*ln do not know over what they stumble.
My*ln son, give attention to my words; Incline*ln your ear to my sayings.
Do*ln not let them depart from your sight; Keep*ln them in the midst of your heart.
For*ln they are life to those who find them And*ln health to all their body.
Watch*ln over your heart with all diligence, For*ln from it flow*i the springs of life.
Put*ln away from you a deceitful mouth And*ln put devious speech far from you.
Let*ln your eyes look directly ahead And*ln let your gaze be fixed straight in front of you.
Watch*ln the path of your feet And*ln all your ways will be established.
Do*ln not turn to the right nor to the left; Turn*ln your foot from evil.
